description: Simple 2-deliverable PR campaign for integration testing. Validates that Lisa can create PR materials, run AP Style and brand checks, and complete successfully.

deliverables.title: Product announcement press release
deliverables.description: Press release announcing new product feature. Lead with news (what launched, when available). Include customer traction metric (e.g., '50 companies adopted in beta'). CEO quote on market impact. Customer quote on practical benefits. Boilerplate paragraph about company. Media contact info. Follow AP Style: dates (Jan. 15, 2026), times (9 a.m. ET), numbers (spell out one-nine, numerals 10+). Word count: 400-500 words. Professional, factual tone. No hype or superlatives.
acceptanceCriteria: Lead paragraph includes: what, when, key innovation
2 quotes: CEO and customer, properly attributed
Boilerplate paragraph about company at end
Follows AP Style for dates, times, numbers
deliverables.notes: First test deliverable. Tests brand, readability, and AP Style quality gates (no SEO for PR).

deliverables.title: Media pitch for tech journalists
deliverables.description: Email pitch to tech journalists about product announcement. Subject line with specific news hook (e.g., 'X companies adopt new Y technology'). Body: Lead with most newsworthy stat or fact. Explain why this matters now (market trend, customer pain). What's different/innovative. Customer proof. Timing angle if relevant. Offer CEO interview, customer intro, demo access. Keep under 250 words - journalists are busy. Conversational but professional tone. Follow AP Style for any dates, numbers.
acceptanceCriteria: Subject line with specific news hook
Lead with most compelling stat or fact
Differentiates from competitors or status quo
Clear offers: CEO interview, demo, customer access
Follows AP Style for any dates/numbers
deliverables.notes: Second test deliverable. Tests all PR quality gates: brand, readability, AP Style.
